name: Steel Frame
description: Exposed steel beams and columns with expressed joints. Available as painted (RAL colours) or exposed/galvanised finish.
insight: High embodied carbon in raw materials extraction due to energy-intensive metal production. Prioritise high recycled content steel (verified) and EAF supply where available to reduce impact. In-use phase performs well due to durability and recyclability.
actions: Provide an EPD (EN 15804) or verified embodied carbon figure (A1–A3), and state the life-cycle stages covered.
Aim for high recycled content (verify) and prefer electric-arc furnace steel where available
Specify bolted connections so it can be taken apart and reused
healthNote: Inert material with no off-gassing. Coatings and fire protection may contain VOCs—specify low-emission products.

name: Glulam (Beams + Columns)

insight: Bio-based material with low embodied carbon across lifecycle. raw materials extraction performs exceptionally well. Ensure FSC/PEFC certification to maintain sustainability credentials. Consider end-of-life reuse or biomass recovery.
actions: Provide FSC or PEFC chain-of-custody proof (and origin details if reclaimed).
Verify adhesive type and formaldehyde emissions
Verify fire treatment is non-toxic and doesn't impair recyclability
healthNote: Natural material with good indoor air quality. Verify adhesive emissions class (E1 or better) for enclosed spaces.

name: Metal Chair
description: Powder-coated steel or aluminum chair; durable and suitable for indoor/outdoor use.
insight: High embodied carbon in raw materials extraction due to energy-intensive metal production. Prioritise high recycled content steel (verified) and EAF supply where available to reduce impact. In-use phase performs well due to durability and recyclability.
actions: Provide an EPD (EN 15804) or verified embodied carbon figure (A1–A3), and state the life-cycle stages covered.
Prioritise high recycled content metal (verify)
Specify repairable components and replaceable glides
healthNote: Inert material with no off-gassing. Verify coatings are low-VOC.

name: Plywood Furniture
description: Furniture constructed from birch or FSC plywood; lightweight and economical.
insight: Bio-based material with low embodied carbon across lifecycle. raw materials extraction performs exceptionally well. Ensure FSC/PEFC certification to maintain sustainability credentials. Consider end-of-life reuse or biomass recovery.
actions: Provide FSC or PEFC chain-of-custody proof (and origin details if reclaimed).
Verify low-formaldehyde class (E1 or better)
Specify repairable construction and refinishing
healthNote: Natural material. Engineered products may use adhesives—verify low emissions and low-VOC finishes.

name: Reclaimed Timber Furniture
description: Furniture made from reclaimed timber; unique character and minimal embodied carbon.
insight: Bio-based material with low embodied carbon across lifecycle. raw materials extraction performs exceptionally well. Ensure FSC/PEFC certification to maintain sustainability credentials. Consider end-of-life reuse or biomass recovery.
actions: Provide FSC or PEFC chain-of-custody proof (and origin details if reclaimed).
Verify provenance and ensure treatments are non-toxic
Specify repairable construction and refinishing
healthNote: Reclaimed timber is low-emission. Verify any treatments are non-toxic.

name: Modular Shelving
description: Modular shelving system; flexible, reusable, and easy to reconfigure.
insight: Focus on reducing manufacturing impact through specification choices—this is the primary carbon hotspot. In-use impacts are typically low. Request EPD data to verify assumptions.
actions: Provide an EPD (EN 15804) or verified embodied carbon figure (A1–A3), and state the life-cycle stages covered.
Prioritise high recycled content metal (verify) and durable finishes
Specify modular components for reconfiguration and repair
healthNote: Inert material with no off-gassing. Verify coatings are low-VOC.
